column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=CHAPTER VIII .
#Text=THE ROOF SPACES
#Text=As the fans in the circular aperture of the inner room rotated and permitted glimpses of the night , dim sounds drifted in thereby .
#Text=And Graham , standing underneath , wrestling darkly with the unknown powers that imprisoned him , and which he had now deliberately challenged , was startled by the sound of a voice .
#Text=He peered up and saw in the intervals of the rotation , dark and dim , the face and shoulders of a man regarding him .

#Text=When a dark hand was extended , the swift fan struck it , swung round and beat on with a little brownish patch on the edge of its thin blade , and something began to fall therefrom upon the floor , dripping silently .
#Text=Graham looked down , and there were spots of blood at his feet .
#Text=He looked up again in a strange excitement .
#Text=The figure had gone .
#Text=He remained motionless -- his every sense intent upon the flickering patch of darkness , for outside it was high night .
#Text=He became aware of some faint , remote , dark specks floating lightly through the outer air .
#Text=They came down towards him , fitfully , eddyingly , and passed aside out of the uprush from the fan .
#Text=A gleam of light flickered , the specks flashed white , and then the darkness came again .
#Text=Warmed and lit as he was , he perceived that it was snowing within a few feet of him .
#Text=Graham walked across the room and came back to the ventilator again .
#Text=He saw the head of a man pass near .
#Text=There was a sound of whispering .
#Text=Then a smart blow on some metallic substance , effort , voices , and the vans stopped .
#Text=A gust of snowflakes whirled into the room , and vanished before they touched the floor .
#Text=“ Do n’t be afraid , ” said a voice .
#Text=Graham stood under the fan .
#Text=“ Who are you ? ” he whispered .
#Text=For a moment there was nothing but a swaying of the fan , and then the head of a man was thrust cautiously into the opening .
#Text=His face appeared nearly inverted to Graham ; his dark hair was wet with dissolving flakes of snow upon it .
#Text=His arm went up into the darkness holding something unseen .
#Text=He had a youthful face and bright eyes , and the veins of his forehead were swollen .
#Text=He seemed to be exerting himself to maintain his position .
#Text=For several seconds neither he nor Graham spoke .
#Text=“ You were the Sleeper ? ” said the stranger at last .
#Text=“ Yes , ” said Graham .
#Text=“ What do you want with me ? ”
#Text=“ I come from Ostrog , Sire . ”
#Text=“ Ostrog ? ”
#Text=The man in the ventilator twisted his head round so that his profile was towards Graham .
#Text=He appeared to be listening .
#Text=Suddenly there was a hasty exclamation , and the intruder sprang back just in time to escape the sweep of the released fan .
#Text=And when Graham peered up there was nothing visible but the slowly falling snow .
#Text=It was perhaps a quarter of an hour before anything returned to the ventilator .
#Text=But at last came the same metallic interference again ; the fans stopped and the face reappeared .
#Text=Graham had remained all this time in the same place , alert and tremulously excited .
#Text=“ Who are you ?
#Text=What do you want ? ” he said .
#Text=“ We want to speak to you , Sire , ” said the intruder .
#Text=“ We want -- I ca n’t hold the thing .
#Text=We have been trying to find a way to you these three days . ”
#Text=“ Is it rescue ? ” whispered Graham .
#Text=“ Escape ? ”
#Text=“ Yes , Sire .
#Text=If you will . ”
#Text=“ You are my party -- the party of the Sleeper ? ”
#Text=“ Yes , Sire . ”
#Text=“ What am I to do ? ” said Graham .
#Text=There was a struggle .
#Text=The stranger ’s arm appeared , and his hand was bleeding .
#Text=His knees came into view over the edge of the funnel .
#Text=“ Stand away from me , ” he said , and he dropped rather heavily on his hands and one shoulder at Graham ’s feet .
#Text=The released ventilator whirled noisily .
#Text=The stranger rolled over , sprang up nimbly and stood panting , hand to a bruised shoulder , and with his bright eyes on Graham .
#Text=“ You are indeed the Sleeper , ” he said .
#Text=“ I saw you asleep .
#Text=When it was the law that anyone might see you . ”
#Text=“ I am the man who was in the trance , ” said Graham .
#Text=“ They have imprisoned me here .
#Text=I have been here since I awoke -- at least three days . ”
#Text=The intruder seemed about to speak , heard something , glanced swiftly at the door , and suddenly left Graham and ran towards it , shouting quick incoherent words .
#Text=A bright wedge of steel flashed in his hand , and he began tap , tap , a quick succession of blows upon the hinges .
#Text=“ Mind ! ” cried a voice .
#Text=“ Oh ! ”
#Text=The voice came from above .
#Text=Graham glanced up , saw the soles of two feet , ducked , was struck on the shoulder by one of them , and a heavy weight bore him to the earth .
#Text=He fell on his knees and forward , and the weight went over his head .
#Text=He knelt up and saw a second man from above seated before him .
#Text=“ I did not see you , Sire , ” panted the man .
#Text=He rose and assisted Graham to arise .
#Text=“ Are you hurt , Sire ? ” he panted .
#Text=A succession of heavy blows on the ventilator began , something fell close to Graham ’s face , and a shivering edge of white metal danced , fell over , and lay flat upon the floor .
#Text=“ What is this ? ” cried Graham , confused and looking at the ventilator .
#Text=“ Who are you ?
#Text=What are you going to do ?
#Text=Remember , I understand nothing . ”
